DOC.brief_summary: The Poly Cystic Ovary Syndrome ( PCOS ) , one common reason subfertility , oligomenorrhea amenorrhea . With occurrence 6-20 % general adult woman population . One main criterion syndrome hyper androgenic state . More 50 % woman PCOS overweight . In teenage population , PCOS common 5-10 % teenage girl . A recent research show elite athlete teenage girl higher serum androgen level , especially anaerobic type sport . The purpose experiment examine reaction teenage PCOS overweight girl towards anaerobic exercise . To determine hyperandrogenic state adapt excel anaerobic exercise compare teenage overweight girl without PCOS .
DOC.brief_title: Clinical Sciences Research Proposal- The Effect Physical Exercise PCOS Overweight Female Adolescents
DOC.detailed_description: 30 teenage young adult female , age 10-25 year old . The minimum hormonal age inclusion menarche . Overweight- Body Mass Index ( BMI ) percentage 85 % , divide 2 group : 15 girl diagnose PCOS , 15 girl without diagnosed PCOS , without medical comorbidities . Followed pediatric endocrinology unit . The 2 group would participate 2 anaerobic test evaluate performance . The data receive used evaluate anaerobic attribute , comparison 2 group determine difference . The participant ask refrain form physical exercise previous day . After explanation patient parent obtain informed consent , participant start test . The first test Repeated Sprint Test : The participant run distance 40 meter , 6 repetition . The optimal running time calculate , total running time Performance Decrement run calculate . After , 1-1.5 hour rest phase . The second test `` Wingate Test '' - participant instruct pedal maximal pace 30 second ergometric bicycle resistance adjust accord BMI . The Peak Anaerobic Power , Mean Anaerobic Power Fatigue Index calculate .
DOC.criteria: post menarche female PCOS diagnosis overweight BMI 85 percent . inability complete physical activity due health issue Thyroid dysfunction ( hyper , hypo ) hyperprolactinemia congenital adrenal hyperplasia
